org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.iteration

Interface IterationStrategyStack

  • All Superinterfaces:
    WorkflowItem
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IterationStrategyStackImpl

    public interface IterationStrategyStack
extends WorkflowItem
    Stack of iteration strategy containers. The stacking behaviour allows for staged implicit iteration where intermediate strategies are used to drill into the collection structure to a certain depth with a final one used to render job objects containing data at the correct depth for the process. This was achieved in Taverna 1 through the combination of nested workflows and 'forcing' processors which could echo and therefore force input types of the workflow to a particular cardinality.
    Author:
    Tom Oinn

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getIterationDepth(Map<String,Integer> inputDepths)
      Calculate the depth of the iteration strategy stack as a whole given a set of named inputs and their cardinalities.
      List<? extends IterationStrategy> getStrategies()
      The iteration strategy stack consists of an ordered list of iteration strategies.

    • Method Detail

      • getStrategies

        List<? extends IterationStrategy> getStrategies()
        The iteration strategy stack consists of an ordered list of iteration strategies.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable copy of the list containing the iteration strategy objects in order, with the strategy at position 0 in the list being the one to which data is fed first.

      • getIterationDepth

        int getIterationDepth(Map<String,Integer> inputDepths)
               throws IterationTypeMismatchException,
                      MissingIterationInputException
        Calculate the depth of the iteration strategy stack as a whole given a set of named inputs and their cardinalities. This depth is the length of the index array which will be added to any output data, so the resultant output of each port in the owning processor is the depth of that port as defined by the activity plus this value.
        Parameters:
        inputDepths -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IterationTypeMismatchException
        MissingIterationInputException
